General.Name: Sojitz Corporation
General.Description: Sojitz Corporation operates as a general trading company that engages in various business activities worldwide. It operates through Automotive; Aerospace & Transportation Project; Infrastructure & Healthcare; Metals, Mineral Resources & Recycling; Chemicals; Consumer Industry & Agriculture Business; Retail & Consumer Service; and Others segments. The company is involved in the assembly and sale of automobiles, auto-financing business, and parts quality assurance business with customers comprising automobile and automobile parts manufacturers; and operation as an authorized dealer for premium brand vehicles. It also engages in the aircraft leasing, parts out, business jets, in-flight chartering, and transportation infrastructure businesses. In addition, it is involved in the healthcare, telecommunication, and urban infrastructure development businesses; development and operation of solar, wind, and biomass projects; gas-related and fired power generation business; data center; and urban infrastructure and industrial park businesses. Further, it acquires and develops contract mining business, invests and trades in metal resources and ferrous materials; conducts trading and businesses ranging from basic materials to functional materials; coal; Iron ore; Ferroalloys, ores, alumina, aluminum, copper, zinc, precious metals, ceramics and minerals, coke, carbon products; steel-related business; and resource recycling business. Additionally, it engages in developing operations in the fields of agribusiness, foodstuffs, animal feed, and forest products. Further, it is involved in a range of retail consumer businesses comprising food distribution, aquaculture, shopping center management, consumer goods distribution, textile, and real estate activities; and logistics and insurance services, automobile and motorcycle parts, industrial machinery, bearing, nuclear power-related equipment businesses, etc. The company was incorporated in 2003 and is headquartered in Tokyo, Japan.
